verses.verse: Now as Jacob<WH3290> went<WH1980> on his way,<WH1870> the angels<WH4397> of God<WH430> met<WH6293> him.
And Jacob<WH3290> said<WH559> when<WH9201> he saw<WH7200> them, "This<WH2088> is God's camp.<WH4264>" So he named<WH7121> <WH8034> that place<WH4725> Mahanaim.<WH4266>
Then Jacob<WH3290> sent<WH7971> messengers<WH4397> before<WH6440> him to his brother<WH251> Esau<WH6215> in the land<WH776> of Seir,<WH8165> the country<WH7704> of Edom.<WH9000>

He also commanded<WH6680> them saying,<WH559> "Thus<WH3541> you shall say<WH559> to my lord<WH113> Esau:<WH6215> 'Thus<WH3541> says<WH559> your servant<WH5650> Jacob,<WH3290> "I have sojourned<WH1481> with Laban,<WH3837> and stayed<WH309> until<WH5704> now;<WH6258>

and I have<WH1961> oxen<WH7794> and donkeys<WH2543> [and] flocks<WH6629> and male<WH5650> and female<WH8198> servants<WH5650>;<WH8198> and I have sent<WH7971> to tell<WH5046> my lord,<WH113> that I may find<WH4672> favor<WH2580> in your sight.<WH5869>"' "

And the messengers<WH4397> returned<WH7725> to Jacob,<WH3290> saying,<WH559> "We came<WH935> to your brother<WH251> Esau,<WH6215> and furthermore<WH1571> he is coming<WH1980> to meet<WH7122> you, and four<WH702> hundred<WH3967> men<WH376> are with him."

Then Jacob<WH3290> was greatly<WH3966> afraid<WH3372> and distressed;<WH9503> and he divided<WH2673> the people<WH5971> who<WH834> were with him, and the flocks<WH6629> and the herds<WH1241> and the camels,<WH1581> into two<WH8147> companies;<WH4264>
for he said,<WH559> "If<WH518> Esau<WH6215> comes<WH935> to the one<WH259> company<WH4264> and attacks<WH5221> it, then the company<WH4264> which is left<WH7604> will escape.<WH6413>"

And Jacob<WH3290> said,<WH559> "O God<WH430> of my father Abraham<WH1> and God<WH85> of my father Isaac,<WH430> O Lord,<WH1> who didst say<WH3327> to me, 'Return<WH3068> to your country<WH559> and to your relatives,<WH7725> and I will prosper<WH776> you,'

I am unworthy<WH6994> of all<WH3605> the lovingkindness<WH2617> and of all<WH3605> the faithfulness<WH571> which<WH834> Thou hast shown<WH6213> to Thy servant;<WH5650> for with my staff<WH4731> [only] I crossed<WH5674> this<WH2088> Jordan,<WH3383> and now<WH6258> I have become<WH1961> two<WH8147> companies.<WH4264>

"Deliver<WH5337> me, I pray,<WH4994> from the hand<WH3027> of my brother,<WH251> from the hand<WH3027> of Esau;<WH6215> for I fear<WH3372> him, lest<WH6435> he come<WH935> and attack<WH5221> me, the mothers<WH517> with the children.<WH1121>

"For Thou didst say,<WH559> 'I will surely<WH3190> prosper<WH3190> you, and make<WH7760> your descendants<WH2233> as the sand<WH2344> of the sea,<WH3220> which<WH834> cannot<WH3808> be numbered<WH5608> for multitude.<WH7230>'"
So he spent<WH3885> the night<WH3915> there.<WH8033> Then he selected<WH3947> from what he had<WH935> with him a present<WH4503> for his brother<WH251> Esau: <WH6215>
two hundred<WH3967> female<WH5795> goats<WH5795> and twenty<WH6242> male<WH8495> goats,<WH8495> two hundred<WH3967> ewes<WH7353> and twenty<WH6242> rams,<WH352>

thirty<WH7970> milking<WH3243> camels<WH1581> and their colts,<WH1121> forty<WH705> cows<WH6510> and ten<WH6235> bulls,<WH6499> twenty<WH6242> female<WH860> donkeys<WH860> and ten<WH6235> male<WH5895> donkeys.<WH5895>

And he delivered<WH5414> [them] into the hand<WH3027> of his servants,<WH5650> every<WH5739> drove<WH5739> by itself,<WH905> and said<WH559> to his servants,<WH5650> "Pass<WH5674> on before<WH6440> me, and put<WH7760> a space<WH7305> between<WH996> droves.<WH5739>"

And he commanded<WH6680> the one<WH7223> in front,<WH7223> saying,<WH559> "When<WH3588> my brother<WH251> Esau<WH6215> meets<WH6298> you and asks<WH7592> you, saying,<WH559> 'To whom<WH4310> do you belong, and where<WH575> are you going,<WH1980> and to whom<WH4310> do these<WH428> [animals] in front<WH6440> of you belong?'

then you shall say,<WH559> '[These] belong to your servant<WH5650> Jacob;<WH3290> it is a present<WH4503> sent<WH7971> to my lord<WH113> Esau.<WH6215> And behold,<WH2009> he also<WH1571> is behind<WH310> us.' "

Then he commanded<WH6680> also<WH1571> the second<WH8145> and the third,<WH7992> and all<WH3605> those who followed<WH1980> <WH310> the droves,<WH5739> saying,<WH559> "After this<WH2088> manner<WH1697> you shall speak<WH1696> to Esau<WH6215> when you find<WH4672> him;

and you shall say,<WH559> 'Behold,<WH2009> your servant<WH5650> Jacob<WH3290> also<WH1571> is behind<WH310> us.' "For he said,<WH559> "I will appease<WH3722> <WH6440> him with the present<WH4503> that goes<WH1980> before<WH6440> me. Then afterward<WH310> <WH3651> I will see<WH7200> his face;<WH6440> perhaps<WH194> he will accept<WH5375> <WH6440> me. "
So the present<WH4503> passed<WH5674> on before<WH5921> <WH6440> him, while he himself<WH1931> spent<WH3885> that night<WH3915> in the camp.<WH4264>

Now he arose<WH6965> that same<WH1931> night<WH3915> and took<WH3947> his two<WH8147> wives<WH802> and his two<WH8147> maids<WH8198> and his eleven<WH259> <WH6240> children,<WH3206> and crossed<WH5674> the ford<WH4569> of the Jabbok.<WH2999>
And he took<WH3947> them and sent<WH5674> them across<WH5674> the stream.<WH5158> And he sent<WH5674> across<WH5674> whatever<WH834> he had.
Then Jacob<WH3290> was left<WH3498> alone,<WH905> and a man<WH376> wrestled<WH79> with him until<WH5704> daybreak.<WH7837>

And when he saw<WH7200> that he had not prevailed<WH3201> against him, he touched<WH5060> the socket<WH3709> of his thigh;<WH3409> so the socket<WH3709> of Jacob's thigh<WH3409> was dislocated<WH3363> while he wrestled<WH79> with him.
Then he said,<WH559> "Let<WH7971> me go,<WH7971> for the dawn<WH7837> is breaking.<WH5927>" But he said,<WH559> "I will not let<WH7971> you go<WH7971> unless<WH3588> <WH518> you bless<WH1288> me."
So he said<WH559> to him, "What<WH4100> is your name<WH8034>?" And he said,<WH559> "Jacob.<WH3290>"

And he said,<WH559> "Your name<WH8034> shall no<WH3808> longer<WH5750> be Jacob,<WH3290> but Israel;<WH3478> for you have striven<WH8280> with God<WH430> and with men<WH376> and have prevailed.<WH3201>"

Then Jacob<WH3290> asked<WH7592> him and said,<WH559> "Please<WH4994> tell<WH5046> me your name.<WH8034>" But he said,<WH559> "Why<WH4100> is it that you ask<WH7592> my name<WH8034>?" And he blessed<WH1288> him there.<WH8033>
So Jacob<WH3290> named<WH7121> <WH8034> the place<WH4725> Peniel,<WH6439> for [he said,] "I have seen<WH7200> God<WH430> face<WH6440> to face,<WH6440> yet my life<WH5315> has been preserved.<WH5337>"
Now the sun<WH8121> rose<WH2224> upon him just<WH9201> as he crossed<WH5674> over<WH5674> Penuel,<WH6439> and he was limping<WH6760> on his thigh.<WH3409>

Therefore,<WH5921> <WH3651> to this<WH2088> day<WH3117> the sons<WH1121> of Israel<WH3478> do not eat<WH398> the sinew<WH1517> of the hip<WH5384> which<WH834> is on the socket<WH3709> of the thigh,<WH3409> because<WH3588> he touched<WH5060> the socket<WH3709> of Jacob's thigh<WH3409> in the sinew<WH1517> of the hip.<WH5384>
